article_title: Mexico and Malaysia Central Bankers: Ready for Liftoff
article_text:
NEW HAVEN, Conn.—A group of global central bankers, regulators and finance ministry officials gathered on the campus of Yale University this week to discuss global financial crises and how to respond to them.

The Wall Street Journal caught up with two participants on the sidelines—Agustin Carstens, governor of the Bank of Mexico, and Zeti Akhtar Aziz, governor of Bank Negara Malaysia—for brief chats about financial stability and expectations the U.S. Federal Reserve will soon start raising short-term interest rates from...

twitter.description: As the Fed prepares to raise interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade, the heads of the two central banks describe how markets will react.
twitter.title: Mexico and Malaysia Central Bankers: Ready for Liftoff
